description: From the obsolete sense of the English verb splendish (“to shine”), from Latin splendere (“to shine”), or from resplend +‎ -ent, from Latin resplendere.

adjectives.description: resplendent (comparative more resplendent, superlative most resplendent)

entries.meaning: Shiny and colourful, and thus pleasing to the eye.
(mathematics) Exhibiting the property of resplendency in Peano arithmetic.
